results.title: Tasmania is...
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and Jane Bampton
results.brief_description: The activities and scope of the Directorate of Industrial Development and Trade are highlighted. Covers the broad spectrum of industry and looks at the social attitudes held by the Tasmanians themselves.

results.title: Tasmania's holiday highlands
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production and Brian Merrett
results.brief_description: In the heart of Tasmania’s scenic highlands, a wealth of hydro-electric power is produced through twelve dams and power stations linked by rivers, canals, pipelines and tunnels. These beautiful natural and man-made lakes attract tourists of all kinds, especially hikers and salmon fishermen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production and Brian Merrett

results.title: Taronga
results.creator_credit: Taronga Zoological Park Trust and Lawrence Collings
results.brief_description: Taronga, which is an aboriginal name for beautiful view, is the home of the extensive collection of animals and birds of the Zoological Trust on the North Shore of Sydney Harbour. The film follows a party of children on their tour of the grounds and shows koalas, emus, kangaroos and Australian birds as well as the larger animals from overseas. Amusements available to the children include being allowed to hold and feed baby animals in the nursery and to go for rides on elephants and miniature trains.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Taronga Zoological Park Trust and Lawrence Collings

results.title: Tarka the otter
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions and David Cobham
results.brief_description: Adapted from Henry Williamson’s 1927 novel. Traces the life of Tarka from birth through a series of adventures until its eventual confrontation with humans. Narrated by Peter Ustinov.

results.title: Target for tonight
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and Harry Watt
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of a bombing raid by Britain’s Royal Air Force on a German base in 1941. Covers the preliminary planning beginning with aerial photographic reconnaissance of the objective, preparations and the attack itself.
results.description: A dramatic reconstruction of a bombing raid by Britain’s Royal Air Force on a German base in 1941. Covers the preliminary planning beginning with aerial photographic reconnaissance of the objective, preparations and the attack itself.

results.title: Taps, dies and reamers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”
The process of drilling and countersinking a hole is demonstrated also the cutting of the thread by means of a set of three taps; lubrication is emphasised, and various kinds of tap wrench are shown. Dies of various kinds, and their uses, are demonstrated, as also are parallel, spiral, tapered, and expanding reamers.

results.title: Tapping Canada's resources
results.brief_description: News magazine items: 1. In the Salt Mines: At Ojibway, Ontario, a journey to glittering white caverns is shown. 2. Trans-Canada Pipeline: The toughest stretch of the world’s longest gas pipeline—northern Ontario—is viewed. 3. Plywood for the World: At the largest plywood mill on Canada’s west coast, strips of veneer are peeled and then glued to form plywood.

results.title: Taperturning
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lathework series”.
Three methods of taper turning are demonstrated and explained. 1. Offset tailstock. 2. Adjustment of compound slide. 3. Taper turning attachment.
